list_definition.definition: to remove frost or ice from (eg a refrigerator)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I keep forgetting to defrost the freezer.
Make sure you defrost the chicken thoroughly.

list_ex_of_english: Retinae were isolated from freshly defrosted eyes.
It was so cold that parts of my anatomy—certain extremities—have still not defrosted, at least according to my wife.
Fish were defrosted at room temperature and the general condition of the fish and any external lesions were noted.
Methods of defrosting food (room temperature, refrigerator, hot or cold water and microwave) were similar in case and control kitchens.
Single worms were defrosted on ice, and crushed in distilled water.
Case and control households with a child under 5 years were more likely to defrost foods in the refrigerator and less likely to keep eggs for more than 1 week.
This method takes account of the difference between wholesale and retail prices and allows for losses due to cutting, defrosting, and so on.
We also have the situation where pigmeat and poultry meat has been frozen, then defrosted, labelled and sold as fresh.
